lines.text: From the land beyond beyond... from the world past hope and fear... I bid you Genie, now appear.
[about to land on Collosa]
May Allah grant we find food and water.
And may Allah grant we find nothing else.

[reading the Genie's inscription]
When the big that is small shall again become tall, into fiery rock to rise you must fall.
Kill! Kill him!
For another such kiss, I'd invent a whole continent.
I cannot return to the real world until I am called by my name... Barani.
[repeated line]
I shall try.

[upon seeing Sadi as the Magician's subject]
Is that not Sadi, your waiting woman?
Yes, papa. She has offered herself as the Magician's subject.
If he can turn her into a contented woman, he is indeed a great magician.

[blushing]
Papa!

[after seeing Sokurah throw a live cobra into the same urn Sadi is in]
It's a serpent! Papa... she will be killed!

[patting her arm]
Allah have mercy on them... both!
Oh, Papa!
Allah has many ways of dealing with hungry men.
From the land beyond beyond. From the world past hope and fear. I bid you, genie, now appear.
I obey the master of the lamp.
I command you to build me a barrier between those men and the Cyclops!
I shall try, o master. I shall try.
[Turns into a fiery pinwheel that deposits a shimmering force field in front of the Cyclops]
[first lines]
Harufa.
Aye, captain?
Sound for a depth.
A sounding? Here?
Aye.
Aye, captain.
Where will you find the crew, Sinbad?
The bravest of my former men will sail with me.
That will not be enough. Where will you find the others?
I'll find them... where men fear the headman's axe more than the cyclops - in the caliph's prison yard.

[upon seeing his daughter in a shrunken state]
Ten thousand devils. What evil sorcery is this?
If you are indeed a magician, why do you not use your great power to slay the one-eyed monster?
I had prepared a potion for just such a purpose... but I could not persuade the Cyclops to swallow it.
Look upon your city. Enjoy the sight for soon it will be rubble and bleached bones.
I have come to raise a crew for the hard and dangerous voyage to the land of Colossa.
The land of the cyclops. We may be thieves and murderers, but we're not fools.
The Caliph of Baghdad has offered you full pardon.
He offers us a choice of two kinds of death.
I fought with the cyclops and here I stand alive as you.
[repeated line]
That's right!
They'll not put a rope around Golar's neck. He'll spit in the cyclops' eye first.
I sometimes wonder what they would think if they could see me as I am.
I do not trust them out of my sight, or in it.
You have committed treason against both Baghdad and Chandra. If you are found within the walls of our city by sunset tomorrow, your eyes will be torn out that you may see no more evil dreams.
[the shrunken princess playfully kicks at grapes]
Sinbad, how can you love a tiny, insignificant female such as I?
A diamond is a tiny thing, yet it is very precious and beautiful.
What weird power restrains that monster?
The man that holds this treasure is safe from even greater danger.
Why didn't you destroy the monster?
The genie of the lamp cannot be used to work harm. But in protection, his powers are invincible.
You hear the verdict. You die at dawn. And my wish for a night of pleasant dreams.
Hear my curse, for it seals your doom. Those who harm us shall be driven mad. Terror shall be in your hearts. And before dawn, you will plead with us for your very lives.
For you, will tie the knot myself, so you will strangle slowly.
We could have sliced them all to bits, but you stopped us to save this idiot who babbles nonsense.
Now we won't be driven mad. We'll just be devoured by sea monsters.
[last lines]
Well done, Baronni. I know you will be as good a sailor as you were a genie.
I shall try, captain. I shall try.
Does he expect to sound here, past the very edge of land?
Perhaps hungry has crazed his mind. His own belly is as empty as ours.
If there was land, it would be such as no man would dare set foot upon.
Sinbad would. He dares anything.
What can it be?
Perhaps a sunken reef.
Or a sea serpent. Or something worse.
Full fathom five!

[prayerfully]
Oh, let it be land.
The most comfortable prison is still a lonely place.
And you're as tiny as I am.
How else could I live inside a lamp?
And such a lovely one.
Land ho! Off the starboard bow!
He has the eyes of an owl. I see nothing.
